main event: A bright white streak of light was observed falling through the sky southwest of Wichita Falls, Texas on September 28, 1960.
interesting points: The sighting was observed by multiple witnesses, including a Sheppard Air Force Base airman, a night watchman, and a Wichita Falls police officer.
The object was described as a bright blue-white light the size of a volleyball that turned yellow as it neared the ground.
A search of the area was conducted but no object was found on the ground.
The investigators concluded the object was most likely a meteor or fireball.
A piece of rubber-like material was recovered by a witness, but it was determined to be unrelated to the sighting.
witnesses: Multiple, including military personnel and police
